description.narrative: The Government of Kenya through the current forest draft policy has recognized the importance of a forestry professional body in the country by ensuring it is well recognized and protected so that members have a free hand in handling professional forestry issues. Through the recognition FSK asserts itself as an important institution that champion forestry science and play the role of a watchdog in forestry issues in the country.However for FSK to effectively perform her core mandate and to build on the past achievements and manage the challenges external support is required. Currently the society has a membership of over 500 individuals with a number of institutions and organizations as corporate members. FSK has the potential to be a reference point for nat ional forestry policy debate and decision-making processes. During the project first phase the society achieved much in setting up infrastructure and governance mechanisms to enhance its mandate. The challenge now is to undertake clear and focused strategi es aimed at changing poor public image of foresters presences of non- professionals/quacks in the forestry sector inadequate forums for collating members views on various forest issues inadequate financial management structure and low membership commitment to ideas of the society it is against these issues that justified the society to develop this proposal for support in strengthening the Forest Professional Body to continue advocating for sustainable forest Management and ensure forest science is correctl y positioned in Kenya
